hero.text: Creative web developer and web designer at the intersection of design and technology, I am passionate about crafting inspiring digital experiences. Merging aesthetics with advanced technology, I create elegant digital solutions that capture attention and turn ideas into unique interactions.

about.title: About
about.description01: Hello ! My name is Auban Labie, a 30-year-old junior front-end developer and UI/UX designer residing in Marche-Les-Dames, in the province of Namur. A passionate Belgian, I find my balance between coding, fitness, and video games. Blessed with a calm and thoughtful nature, I can adapt to various situations. My primary goal? To combine technical skills with aesthetics to create captivating digital experiences. In my eyes, the user experience is at the heart of every successful project.
about.description02: My passion for web development began as a self-taught endeavor, exploring the depths of coding on my own. This self-learning drive later led me to IEPSCF Namur Cadets, where I underwent a rigorous curriculum. Furthermore, my training at BeCode significantly enhanced my skills, strengthening my self-taught foundation, firmly paving my way into the professional world of web development.
about.description03: The journey as a freelancer taught me the value of informed decision-making and prioritization. Each assignment demands meticulous organization to maximize its efficiency. Just as in a corporate setting, the weekly sprint backlog is crucial to align the team with a shared vision and ensure the added value of every accomplishment.

process.title: Process
process.intro: Every project is unique, and my approach adjusts accordingly. However, I am convinced that a structured process is essential to ensure the success of every project.

step01.title: Planning
step01.description: Analysis of the project's objectives and requirements based on the provided specifications or available information. Development of a detailed project plan, including a timeline, an estimate of the required resources, and defining responsibilities for each team member.

step02.title: Design
step02.description: Exploration of current design and feature trends to draw inspiration and design an innovative solution tailored to the project's needs. Consulting inspiration sources such as Dribbble, Behance, or Awwwards to identify relevant ideas and approaches. Creating mockups and prototypes for the user interface and user experience, using tools like Figma or Adobe XD. Presenting the concepts to the client and integrating feedback to refine the design.

step03.title: Development
step03.description: Transforming mockups into functional code using technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like Vue.js or React. Development of the back-end architecture and integration with databases and APIs, as needed.

step04.title: Deployment
step04.description: Launching the site on a production server, using hosting tools and services such as Git, Netlify, or Heroku. Optimizing the site's performance to ensure a smooth user experience. Monitoring and resolving technical issues that may arise after the site's launch.

skills.title: Skills
skills.intro: My technical and non-technical skills are the result of solid training, diverse professional experience, and a constant commitment to learning and improvement. They make me a valuable asset to any project team.

portfolio.name: Portfolio
portfolio.description: My portfolio, designed with Vue.js and enhanced by Three.js, showcases my web development projects and skills. It also provides an insight into my personality and a contact section for those wishing to collaborate.

museum.name: Museum Project
museum.description: The 'Museum project' was a team endeavor during my training at BeCode. A project centered on HTML and CSS, designed to deepen our mastery of these fundamental technologies.

forum.name: Forum bcbb the who
forum.description: During my training at BeCode, I co-created the 'Forum bcbb the who'. An interactive platform primarily developed with HTML, SCSS, PHP, and mySQL, allowing registration, login, and message sending for a complete user experience.

restaurant.name: Chaos Coffee Restaurant
restaurant.description: During my training at BeCode, the 'Chaos Coffee Restaurant' project challenged our team to build a showcase site for a restaurant using WordPress. Starting with a few images, we crafted a complete and professional website.

mwenbwa.name: Mwenbwa Corses
mwenbwa.description: At BeCode, we developed 'Mwenbwa Corses', an online IDLE game based in Li√®ge. Using HTML, SCSS, and M.E.R.N., the project combines a REST API with a React SPA.

pomodoro.name: React Pomodoro
pomodoro.description: The 'Pomodoro' was crafted during my training at BeCode. Completed solo, this project allowed me to create an efficient Pomodoro timer using the React framework, showcasing my front-end development skills.

faq.intro: Before sending me a message, here are some things you should know :

question01.question: Am I open to new professional opportunities ?
question01.answer: Absolutely ! I am always on the lookout for new opportunities to learn, grow, and contribute to a team's success.

question02.question: What are your favorite web development tools? Why do you use them ?
question02.answer: I have a preference for Vue.js when it comes to creating responsive and modular user interfaces. Its simplicity and flexibility allow me to develop quickly while maintaining a clean code structure. For the code editor, I use WebStorm because of its advanced debugging features, built-in support for Vue, and its suite of tools that make my workflow more efficient.

question03.question: How do you approach problem-solving when building a website or an application ?
question03.answer: When I encounter a problem, I start by breaking it down into smaller steps or components to understand it. I then use documentation, developer forums, and other resources to find solutions. If necessary, I do not hesitate to collaborate with my colleagues to get different perspectives.

question04.question: How do you collaborate with other developers and team members to ensure the success of a web development project ?
question04.answer: Communication is key for me. I always make sure to fully understand the needs and feedback of my colleagues. I use tools like Git for versioning, which facilitates collaboration. Moreover, I'm always open to feedback and adapt quickly to ensure the project progresses smoothly. When major decisions need to be made, I don't hesitate to seek opinions or suggest solutions that could be beneficial for the team and the project.
